title: Rob Worrincy
text:
Robert Worrincy (born 9 July 1985) is an English retired <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> footballer. He played as a winger for the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a>, <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a>, and <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>.
Background.
Worrincy was born in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England. He is of Anglo-Nigerian-Welsh heritage.
He is the elder brother of the rugby league player; <a href="Michael%20Worrincy">Michael Worrincy</a>.
Career.
Worrincy played for <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 812</a>) in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and was previously with the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> and <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull FC</a>. He had previously played for the <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a> and <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> in the <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Kingstone Press Championship</a> during separate spells. In November 2017 he signed to play for Dewsbury Rams. In 2021, while at Sheffield, Worrincy announced his retirement from the game. He scored a try in the last minute of his final game in 78-10 loss at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>.
